page.title: 07Travel to the Mainland, Ryde
page.content: From Ryde Pier there is a passenger ferry to Portsmouth operated by Sealink. This is a private company now having bought the business from the nationalised company.This caused some problems in 1985 because some passengers had to buy separate tickets for the boat and train. Through tickets can now be bought again. The same company also runs the Car ferry from Fishbourne to Portsmouth. A company called Hovertravel runs the Hovercraft from Ryde to Southsea.They have the Royal Mail contract and take only ten minutes to cross. Many of the commuters use this route and Sealink are talking about buying a new faster catamaran type boat to win back some of the passengers.
